item.title: Pacific News Minute: Study Shows Most Reef Islands Remain Stable or Grow Despite Sea Level Rise
item.description:
Pacific News Minute: Study Shows Most Reef Islands Remain Stable or Grow Despite Sea Level Rise

For many years, we've heard that climate change will make the low lying islands of many Pacific nations uninhabitable over the next few decades. Now a new study shows that despite the effects of sea level rise and more powerful storms, most reef islands have persisted and even grown.

item.title: Perishing Of Thirst In A Pacific Paradise
item.description:
Perishing Of Thirst In A Pacific Paradise

This past weekend we have traded our scorching sun for a very welcome downpour. Â The first real rain for nearly 2 months couldn't have come soon enough when many families only have a single 1500 gallon tank for a single household. Not enough to break the drought that holds us, but just enough to wet our lips and bring us back from teetering over the edge.

item.title: Distribution Room
item.description:
Distribution Room

This is the first step of distribution from here the power goes down the three different power lines and begins it journey to the customers house.
